Example Behavioral Modeling. Changing jobs distribution can be used to produce new plausible geometries. An initial city is located on the left side of a river (c) and has the job distribution shown in (a) and the population distribution shown in (b). A new employment area is sketched on the right side of the river (d). The system then increases and relocates population to meet the new job offer (e), and a second city is built on the right side of the river (f).
